questions.question: 1. The sequencing technology that benefits most from the De-Burgin graph-based sequence assembly is

answers.a: Division of the large pieces of DNA into small pieces and reading the small fragments that constitute the original DNA molecule by connecting the information on various short fragments
answers.b: Segmenting the smaller pieces of DNA to study the original sequence of the given DNA molecule.
answers.c: Integrating the smaller pieces of DNA to larger DNA sequences to study the sequence assembly of the given DNA molecule.
answers.d: Division of the large pieces of DNA into small pieces of DNA for sequence alignment.

questions.question: 4. Identify the major challenge in the construction of De Bruijn graphs.
5. Choose the primary purpose of constructing a De Bruijn graph in genome assembly.

answers.a: Alignment of sequencing reads to a reference genome
answers.b: Counting the frequency of nucleotides in a genome
answers.c: Representation of k-mer overlaps for sequence reconstruction
answers.d: Finding the shortest path in a genome sequence
